result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick E Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution ($50) to be paid the victim L.G. as a Condition of Extended Supervision and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.
AMENDED 06-14-2016:  Restitution is set at zero ($0).

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs are waived.  DNA surcharge ($250) to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Anger Management Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by Agent.
No contact with any of the victims listed the criminal complaint on this case and case 14CM512.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order dismissing

records.addlTxt:
In conduction a no-merit review, a potential issue of arguable merit related to restitution was identified.  Appointed counsel was required to file a supplememental no-merit addressing the potential issue.  The supplemental no-merit report indicates that there is sufficient merit to a claim and that the appellant, Derrick E. Jones, would like to pursue the issue by a postconviction motion.  To return the matter to the circuit court for a postconviction motion we reject the no-merit report, dismiss the appeal, an extend the time under WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30(2)(h), for filing a postconviction motion.

IT IS ORDERED that the no-merit report is rejected and Attorney Peter Bockhorst's motion to be relieved of further representation of Derrick E. Jones is Denied.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the no-merit appeal is dismissed without prejudice.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the time under WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30(2)(h) for filing a postconviction motion is extended to sixty days from remittitur.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: January 28, 2015.
Judgment of Conviction signed and filed
Received and filed in court by the State.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Christine Bohn and  Atty. Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Derrick E Jones in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Robert J. Penegor.
Victim Notification has been complied with.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 5 Years.
Initial Confinement: 2.5  Years.
Extended Supervision: 2.5 Years.
53 Days Credit.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Anger Management Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by agent.  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  any of the Victims listed in the Criminal Complaint on this case and 14CM512.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

RESTITUTION:  $50 (To be paid to Victim (L.G.) listed in the Criminal Complaint - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Costs:  Court Waived.
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250.
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.


Defendant to be transferred to D.C.I. - FORTHWITH.
Sentencing hearing on January 28, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Hearing on October 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Robert J. Penegor in court, defendant Derrick E Jones not in court, in custody.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Penegor advised court that the defendant is currently in custody at Boscobel at the Wisconsin Secure Program Facility when he was to remain at the Waukesha County Jail, but the Sheriff's Department returned him. Attorney Penegor moves to dismiss case for reasons stated on the record. State objects to dismissal for reasons stated on the record. Court denies and adjourns hearing for cause. Defendant to be produced for hearing. 

At 3:42 p.m. case recalled with Defendant, Derrick E. Jones, in court, in custody. Defendant just arrived from State Prison. Attorney Robert J. Penegor in court, defendant Derrick E Jones not in court, in custody.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lindsay G. sworn and testified.  State moves for bindover. Attorney Penegor moves for dismissal.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Information filed, reading waived.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed. Attorney Penegor states next hearing may be by video conference.  Hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
